body: While I do see value in showing how to use encoding with the storage layer, but I think it's much better for user understanding if we have the stores separated. This would also make some of the getters/setters more complicated. Don't think there are pros or cons large enough to justify reworking the tutorial however.

I view this tutorial as more of a getting started example. I'm open to including more content here, but I think keeping the getting started experience streamlined and as focused on the code as possible is good. The examples below explain concepts to various levels, but are all focused on getting users to that "WOW" moment (running application that they built) as quickly as possible:

- [Docker](https://docs.docker.com/get-started/#prepare-your-docker-environment)
- [Kubernetes](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tutorials/kubernetes-basics/)
- [Terraform](https://www.terraform.io/intro/getting-started/build.html)
- [Serverless](https://serverless.com/framework/docs/getting-started/)

One thing to note is that all these tutorials also link to deeper explanations in the documentation. I think this prevents people from getting overloaded on project specific concepts while still providing them ready access to all the different documentation they need.
I really like this idea. I think we should go ahead and make this change.

> I think it's much better for user understanding if we have the stores separated

Why? I don't necessarily agree. The first question I asked myself when reading the tuto was "why do I need one store for each field if the key is the same?". 

The follow up question for most people would be "Does that mean that if I have 15 fields I should have 15 stores?". 
And because the answer is obviously no, then I think we need to introduce types.go and amino encoding of structs. 

> This would also make some of the getters/setters more complicated

Barely.

Overall this is not that big of a change, does not add much complexity and I think it showcases important concepts that users should be aware of.
Like this, and going to merge these changes. I'll open another PR later today to try to move this from module based to app based.
You have convinced me here. Lets go ahead and make this change
Ok, also ran through doing the tutorial and found a couple of bugs introduced by some recent changes to `develop`. I've pushed changes for that as well.
Thank you for doing the thing (splitting `app.md` in two) here. I'm going to go ahead and merge this!
Yes!!!
Need to improve it readme about multi roles
Great addition @yangyanqing!
Definitely! This _is_ blocked on https://github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/issues/1081
Made some adjustments in this other PR https://github.com/cosmos/sdk-application-tutorial/pull/14
closing in favor of: https://github.com/cosmos/sdk-application-tutorial/pull/18

Running into issues with the new bootstrapping process:

- [ ] `nameserviced add-genesis-account` doesn't respect the `--home` flag. It still defaults to `~/.gaiad` not what the app sets. [This likely comes from this line](https://github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/blob/develop/cmd/gaia/init/genesis_accts.go#L61)
- [ ] `nameserviced gen-tx` has the same problem and also has an issue with `--home-client`. [This likely comes from this line](https://github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/blob/develop/cmd/gaia/init/gentx.go#L128-L129)
- [ ] `nameserviced collect-gentxs` also has the same issue. [This likely comes from this line](https://github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/blob/develop/cmd/gaia/init/collect.go#L74)
- [ ] `nameserviced start` doesn't run with the the `genesis.json` created with the above process. Need some help finding root cause here. I have a feeling its in the `initGenesis` command here. 
```
$ nameserviced start
I[29116-11-29|17:04:34.330] Starting ABCI with Tendermint                module=main 
E[29116-11-29|17:04:34.354] Couldn't connect to any seeds                module=p2p 
E[29116-11-29|17:05:04.356] Couldn't connect to any seeds                module=p2p 
```

I've fixed the app initialization and the sum of the above issues is that we don't export the init sequence in a way that other apps can utilize.

cc @alessio
Why was the `build-run.md` file removed? This PR adds the content back to README, which makes little sense to me. Also tutorial parts is duplicated. Can I go ahead and fix this?
yeah fix it. i think i was on an old branch when i commited the bug fix
Thanks! Looks amazing. Will review when R4R. Don't forget to rebase on latest master, I had to fix README a bit.
So far so good :+1:
The best way to review here is to pull down the branch and try to run through the tutorial and build the nameservice app. Sorry for the huge diff, there were a bunch of changes with this release.
Isn't this a duplicate https://github.com/cosmos/sdk-application-tutorial/issues/8?
So this is no longer blocked, and I've done about 1/2 the work here (the code side). We still need a series of HTTP calls to show users how to call the routes (maybe in a `tutorial/run-rest.md`).
yup. Updated #8 with a comment.

@adityanalge In `gaia` we have a [swagger file](https://github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/blob/develop/client/lcd/swagger-ui/swagger.yaml) that describes all the routes there and we have an open issue for adding more [modular support for this feature](https://github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/issues/3011) in the SDK, but that would be a good deal of work. 

I don't see us adding this feature any time soon. Thank you for the suggestion tho!

- [x] `queriers.md` line 8 missing the word "as" in section "which acts a sub-router"
- [x] `cli.md` line 176 doesn't actually say where this content should go (`module_client.go`)
- [x] `rest.md` should give warning to replace the `sdk-application-tutorial` with their own repo like in other places
- [x] `app-complete.md` minor formatting in `app.go` section (`var app = &nameserviceApp{` starts one indent too many)
- [x] `app-complete.md` name of app isn't camelcase (`NewnameserviceApp`)
- [x] `dep.md` where does the makefile go? what is it called?
- [x] `dep.md` the warning about replacing `sdk-application-tutorial`: is it wrt the toml file? cause i don't see it in there. or just in general for the whole repo? did a search on mine and it doesn't appear anywhere
- [x] `cmd/nsd/main.go` missing: 
``` 	
        "path/filepath"
	"io/ioutil"
	"strings"

	"github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/x/auth"

	cfg "github.com/tendermint/tendermint/config"
	sdk "github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/types"

```
and includes unnecessarily:
```
	"github.com/tendermint/tendermint/p2p"
```
- [x] `cmd/nsd/main.go` has different content from final tutorial state from tutorial instructions:
```
//readme says:
	cmd.Flags().String(cli.HomeFlag, DefaultNodeHome, "node's home directory")
	cmd.Flags().BoolP(flagOverwrite, "o", false, "overwrite the genesis.json file")
	cmd.Flags().String(client.FlagChainID, "", "genesis file chain-id, if left blank will be randomly created")
	cmd.Flags().String(flagMoniker, "", "set the validator's moniker")
	cmd.MarkFlagRequired(flagMoniker)
```
```
// repo says:
	cmd.Flags().String(cli.HomeFlag, DefaultNodeHome, "node's home directory")
	cmd.Flags().String(client.FlagChainID, "", "genesis file chain-id, if left blank will be randomly created")
	cmd.Flags().BoolP(flagOverwrite, "o", false, "overwrite the genesis.json file")
```
- [x] `cmd/nscli/main.go` includes unnecessarily:
```
	authcmd "github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/x/auth/client/cli"
```
- [x] `x/nameservice/client/rest/rest.go` users `acc` instead of `addr` for `msg := nameservice.NewMsgSetName(req.Name, req.Value, acc)`
- [x] `x/auth/client/tx.go` error is `x/nameservice/client/cli/tx.go:12:2: imported and not used: "github.com/okwme/cns/vendor/github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/x/auth/client/cli" as authcmd`
- [x] `build-run.md` says to `You can now start nsd by calling nsd start. You will see logs begin streaming that represent blocks being produced, this will take a couple of seconds.`. how long do i wait? what kind of logs should I see? i'm seeing an error one that says "Couldn't connect to any seeds" is this normal? also afterwards when I run the next command:
```
nscli query account $(nscli keys show billy --address) \
    --indent --chain-id testchain
```
(i used billy instead of jack) 
I get an error:
```
ERROR: failed to prove merkle proof: expected 0 args, got 1
```
even when I try it with explicit address:
```
nscli query account cosmos19tfjch2j2uzz3pc53jwug7ghhx2y66g97xn8ac  --indent --chain-id testchain
```
I get the same merkle proof error...


also I get an error after running:
```
nscli tx nameservice buy-name billy.id 5mycoin \
    --from     $(nscli keys show billy --address) \
    --chain-id testchain
```
I got the error:
```
ERROR: No account with address cosmos19tfjch2j2uzz3pc53jwug7ghhx2y66g97xn8ac was found in the state.
Are you sure there has been a transaction involving it?
```

ahaa, i'm thinking i forgot this step:
```
# Add both accounts, with coins to the genesis file
nsd add-genesis-account $(nscli keys show billy --address) 1000mycoin,1000billyCoin
nsd add-genesis-account $(nscli keys show alice --address) 1000mycoin,1000aliceCoin
```
after doing it again with that step i only get the merkle error when querying Alice

ok yup, the billy account (jack account) was able to create, edit, read the new domain. but when the alice account tried to buy it i got:
```bash
$ nscli tx nameservice buy-name billy.id 10mycoin \
    --from     $(nscli keys show alice --address) \
    --chain-id testchain
ERROR: No account with address cosmos1zacyaks57uwszh2vm48p8kh7h6sswqf7gpwady was found in the state.
Are you sure there has been a transaction involving it?
```
this was tried after running `rm -r ~/.nsd` and `rm -r ~/.nscli` and following the `build-run` instructions

ok it's cause i didn't run `nsd init --chain-id testchain` the second time around 😱
i'll checkmark the "errors" from the first post which were just my fault
otherwise that step works : )
Thank you @aknuds1, been meaning to fix this!
You are absolutely right! Thank you for the fix @MasashiSalvador57f!
